intro: Schmaltzia nelsonii, commonly known as Nelson's schmaltzia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually small and lobed, and it produces pink to purple flowers during the spring and early summer. Schmaltzia nelsonii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
